description:
Only Ever Once In a Generation - 246.5ha (610 acres) Rich Volcanic Soils & 555 Megalitres of Water
Held by the same family since 1928 this property consists of some of Victoria's most productive Red & Grey volcanic soils highly suitable for almost any intensive agricultural pursuit. Highly improved with two substantial dwellings, very significant farm improvements and irrigation infrastructure this property is to be sold in either four individual lots or as a whole.
Lot One "Burn Brae" 151 Myers Road, Dean - 75.2ha (186 Acres) Includes a well maintained four bedroom solid brick homestead set amid established gardens. modern 36m x 16m machinery shed/workshop, hayshed 18m x 18m and sundry sheds and 255M centre pivot
Selling inclusive of 230ML water entitlement (150ML Bore & 80ML Surface).
Lot Two "Cairn Bank" 180 - 200 Myers Road, Dean - 76.4ha (189 Acres) comfortable four bedroom home with separate dining room and study abundant shedding, including (but not limited to) potato coolstore (700 tonne capacity), 41M x 28M workshop incorporating two stand woolshed and yards and separate machinery shed. Selling with 100ML surface water entitlement.
Lot 3 - 371 Dean- Mollongghip Rd, - 74.1ha (183 Acres) 100% arable, all red volcanic soils, mains power available and access via three roads. Selling with 192ML of water (168ML Bore & 24ML Surface)
Lot 4 - 120 Myers Rd, 21.1 ha* (52 Ac*) mainly arable red volcanic soils, well fenced with sealed road frontage - selling with 33ML surface water entitlement.
An extremely rare opportunity to secure a first rate and versatile farming operation in one of the most highly regarded districts in Victoria. Dean is conveniently located 15 minutes NE of Ballarat and within a one hour drive of Melbourne.

Complete Central Convenience
This modest 80's style home is instantly appealing with its stylishly renovated spaces, warm ambiance and hidden improvements to make this a fabulous forever home in gorgeous Creswick.
With new galvanised stumps, under floor insulation, an upgraded switchboard and fresh paint inside and out, this inviting home is ready to live-in or lease-out (rent appraised between $280 - $300 per week) with a 2000L water tank, town water, a garden shed and a carport easily accessible to Ballarat Road.
Two spacious bedrooms are well served by a fully updated bathroom with shower, double vanity and separate toilet, while further updates expand to the presentation of the delightful kitchen which displays stainless appliances, excellent storage and an open design..
New carpets and flooring keep everyone comfortable especially in the sun filled double aspect lounge with a split system adding extra contentment all year round.
Well located with school bus pick up across the road and walking distance to the street, this low maintenance property with concrete driveway and new fencing is positioned close to Forest Resort, Ballarat and/or Melbourne via the Midland Highway and Western Freeway.
Well suited to those for looking to keep in touch with the country vibrancy and atmosphere.

Executive Living with Golf Course Views
Located within the pristine grounds of the RACV Goldfields Resort, this amazing executive or family home overlooks the fairway and bushland beyond, where kangaroos can be seen grazing amongst the golfers.
As you enter the home through the oversized front entry door, you are greeted by light filling every space through the south facing walls of double glazed glass - in fact, the whole home is double glazed for your year round comfort. Consisting of 4 enormous bedrooms, the master boasts a walk though robe and an ensuite which has plantation shutters opening up to provide you with a view over the golf course and beyond while you are soaking in the large spa bath. A further bedroom offers a walk through robe and two way access to the family bathroom, while an additional powder room is located on the ground floor for visitors.
The entertainer's kitchen provides tonnes of preparation and serving space with stone benches and waterfall ends. The cabinetry boasts soft closing doors and drawers, and opens onto the deck, also overlooking the golf course through stackable entertaining doors. Approximately 3mt ceilings mean that the spaces feel even bigger than they are, although every room is generously proportioned. The open plan living space is heated by either a gas log fire place, or a convenient split system if you prefer, with all bedrooms also benefitting from the comfort of split systems.
A convenient laundry chute ensures the family's washing makes its way from the upstairs bedrooms with ease, so no more excuses from the kids for not putting their washing out!
A double lock up garage completes the picture of a home that has been designed with family living in mind. Every convenience has been thought of, and every view taken advantage of.
Additional features include:
1. Master TV Star-serve system allowing TV in every room
2. Main living room is wired for 5.1 surround sound home theatre
3. NBN connectivity includes Fibre To The Premise - FTTP for superfast internet and voice
4. Aircon in every room
5. Full golf course frontage
6. Professional landscaping
7. Alarm system
8. Gas log fire
Live the dream today and call our agent for an inspection!

Two For One For The Wise Investor
This is an exciting opportunity for the savvy investor. On offer are two small homes/units on the one title. Each offers a lounge, kitchen, single bedroom and bathroom. The pretty dwellings are set in a quiet area just out of the hub of town, yet just two minutes away, so they are very convenient for the occupants. There is rear car access and a front yard to be enjoyed. These homes have recently let at $190 each per week and therefore grant the investor a fabulous return not matched in recent times. Great buying at this price and with the ability to add value with a small amount of cosmetic work and landscaping, this may well be the safe start to your portfolio.
* This information has been prepared to assist solely in the marketing of this property. While all care has been taken to ensure the information provided herein is correct, we do not take responsibility for any inaccuracies. Accordingly, all interested parties should make their own inquiries to verify the information.

address: 23 Newlyn Reservoir Road Newlyn North VIC 3364
description:
3BR HOME ON HALF ACRE BETWEEN DAYLESFORD-BALLARAT
With deep, rich red soil this property is a gardeners paradise in the township of Newlyn North, just a 10 minute drive to Daylesford or Creswick, 20 minutes to Ballarat and around 90 minutes to Melbourne. The well presented home is set in a quiet and friendly residential area on a corner allotment of approx 2253 sq.m (over half an acre) and features open plan living and 3 bedrooms, with all rooms enjoying an outlook to the surrounding established gardens. This home will suit those seeking their first home, a private country retreat, weekender or rental investment.
3 bedrooms all with large built in robes
Open plan living-dining-kitchen
Kitchen has plenty of bench & storage space, gas cooking
Central bathroom with bath/shower over. Separate toilet. Full laundry
Town water, mains power, split system heating/airconditioning
Septic wastewater system, LP gas (cooking & instant hot water service)
Carport, large lockup steel shed plus 2 garden sheds, cubby house
Huge corner block 2253sq.m. (corner Myles Rd) with rich soil, established gardens, fruit trees, lawn areas
2 minute walk to Newlyn Primary School, school bus to Ballarat nearby
5 minute walk to Newlyn Reservoir - recreational fishing, picnic grounds, home to swans and ducks

50 FERTILE ACRES - BRICK HOMESTEAD PLUS SHEDDING & A FOOD GARDEN!
This productive and attractive farm is located 25 minutes from Castlemaine, Maryborough, Creswick and Daylesford. It has recently undergone substantial upgrades both inside the solid brick homestead and out on the land. The farm offers Hazelnut trees, organic market gardens, four acres of mixed vines, established Olive trees and irrigation infrastructure. The three bedroom home has had a huge amount of work done. With a long and colourful history, including once operating as the Campbelltown Post Office the buildings substantial works include, restumping, replumbing, a new hydronic heating system throughout, new combustion stove and heater, solar hot water heating and a new bathroom. The home is now super well insulated and offers three large bedrooms, a separate lounge, kitchen meals area and a large storage room. Outside, shedding includes, a large semi converted shearing shed (potential cellar door), machinery shed, workshop, dairy and a chook shed. There are two dams, 165,000lts of tank water, the property is well fenced and has massive potential. No chemical or synthetic fertilisers, pesticides or herbicides used on property in preparation for the organic certification. Inspection by appointment.
Internal area
150mÂ²

address: CA 5 & 6 Section 24 Parish Amherst-Lyndhurst Street Talbot VIC 3371
description:
Approx 1998m2 Land on 2 Titles in Historic Talbot
What a great parcel of land for one to build a home and sheds and still have room remaining for the garden, vegie garden and shedding.
Set in Historic Talbot home of the iconic and most popular farmers market on the third Sunday of the month, Talbot is a charming town located in the heart of the Goldfields. Talbot was a thriving center in the early days of the gold rush and many historic buildings remain and close by to Clunes & Maryborough.
Set on approx. 1998M2 on 2 titles (981m2 + 1017m2) this property has services available at the street frontage and is well fenced.
A clean parcel of land providing an easy build site, this block is well worth the look.
Property has previously had Council approval for a dwelling however this has since lapsed. Documents available on request
Call today for more information.

RARE find over 3 acres near town centre Creswick
This fantastic home is set on 3.3 secluded bush acres and backs onto natural bushland and pine plantations that stretch for miles.
This substantial family home is on 2 levels and features a huge open plan kitchen and dining with amazing views across the property through the wrap around windows. There are four bedrooms all with built in robes and a great family bathroom. Two of the bedrooms open directly onto the large upper level deck. The upstairs living area also opens out to a large balcony with breathtaking views. Upstairs has been recently recarpeted. The home has amazing views across the local township of Creswick.
There is a natural wood combustion heater centrally located on the top floor and a large open fireplace on the lower floor. For cooling there is also a split system. The lower floor features a games room of large proportions and an office and storage area suitable for a cellar.
Outdoors through the electric remote gated entrance gives way to a circular driveway. You have a 10x5m swimming pool its a real private oasis, complete with bar and barbeque area. This home would suit those who love to entertain. The home is on town water and has sewerage which is often a bonus on acreage.
There is a three-bay carport plus lock up shed, a further two car bay, one of which has a spray booth with mechanics pit plus a wood shed. One bay has been designed to fit a caravan or boat. There is a stock gate and second bush paddock for horses or other stock. Complete with cattle yards.
An ideal family home for those who love the outdoors would suit those wanting to use the local plantations for recreation on weekends, or for a daily tranquil walk
All this only a 10 minute walk to the town centre. Call to book your private viewing today.

IN A DESIRED LOCATION...
Nestled in the middle of Ascot, we're excited to present this two-bedroom townhouse. With a modern outlook, contemporary design and conveniently located all within a stone's throw to local amenities. This truly stylish town house is complete with two generous sized bedrooms, spacious open plan living, well-appointed kitchen, ducted gas heating, air-conditioning, alfresco area for entertaining and BBQs.
Property Features:
- Quality fixtures/fittings throughout, including ducted gas heating and air-conditioning
- Single garage with auto roller door
- Easy low maintenance property ideal for those who want to lock & leave and enjoys holidays away
- Walking distance to the Epsom Station, Epsom Shopping Village, beautiful landscaped parks and a lot more that this beautiful suburb has to offer
If you're looking in this area then this is a must see; contact Wes Dorrington today on 0433 013 687 to make an appointment to view this property.

Outstanding Opportunity with Massive Shedding, Dual Access and Development Potential
The township of Creswick has a growing population and glowing reputation bringing in people from all over for the cafes, fresh produce shops and market. Situated close to the freeway for an easy commute to Melbourne, and only 15 minutes to the city of Ballarat. An absolutely outstanding opportunity this magnificent home is situated on a massive land holding of approx. 850m2 with both front and rear access and has much to offer the next owner especially those after shedding garages and carport which can accommodate up to 10 vehicles.
First built in the 1860s in the gold rush era the home has been revamped over the years to accommodate all the creature comforts one has come to expect of today including large open plan, light and spacious living, kitchen and dining area with gas heating and warm wood combustion fire. The bathroom has also been updated and the 3 bedrooms plus study would all accommodate queen beds, ideal for the growing family. There is a wonderful under cover outdoor alfresco overlooking the massive rear yard. Features include water tanks, solar electricity, updated kitchen and a massive land holding with room to extend or develop (STCA). This truly is a wonderful opportunity sure to impress so dont wait, call now to book your private viewing today.

"Havenswood" - Magnificent, Totally Private On 40ac Approx.
** (Access Via 565 Telegraph Rd, Mt Prospect) **
Set at the tranquil foot of Mt Prospect you will find a rare opportunity to secure this custom built, architecturally designed, unique family home. On approximately 40 acres, half cleared & half natural bushlands. Located in the beautiful Wombat Forest surrounded by bush trails for horse riding or those that enjoy a nature walk, with an abundance of wildlife right on your doorstep. Country living at its finest, this property is fully sustainable with tank water, septic bio-system treatment plant and 48 volt solar power system with a backup generator. Upon entry you are enveloped with the warm country feel, via Monastery doors into the mudroom, through the barndoors leading to the hub of the home. Entering the open plan living, you will be immediately drawn to the beauty of the interspersed cedar lined ceilings and walls, polished concrete flooring through the lower level of this home gives a level of sophistication. A Castlemaine stone fireplace and a history feature wall in the living area with red brick from the demolished North Melbourne train station adds to the character of the home. Solidly constructed with double rendered brick, Castlemaine stone and locally radially sawn timber with double glazed windows & doors ensure that this beauty is well insulated all year round. Comprising four bedrooms and an office/study, main family bathroom with separate rain shower and raised bath with a relaxing outlook. A stunning kitchen with Aga European Gas Oven, cedar timber benchtops with black cabinetry gives a classy finish. The landing on the stairs has a daybed with a relaxing view overlooking one of two dams, the perfect spot to unwind and catch up on some reading or that afternoon nap whilst the kids are out playing on the large rope swing. A spacious master bedroom with Juliet balcony & built in robe. An existing studio for the artist of the family or simply a teenager's retreat/mancave. Excellent shedding, stalls and fenced horse paddocks. Minutes to Daylesford, under 30 minutes to Ballan Park and ride the train through to Southern Cross Station for those that like to commute. If you are looking for that change in lifestyle, this very private location and dwelling is perfect, do not miss your opportunity - call to arrange your inspection today.
* This information has been prepared to assist solely in the marketing of this property. While all care has been taken to ensure the information provided herein is correct, we do not take responsibility for any inaccuracies. Accordingly, all interested parties should make their own inquiries to verify the information.

Fully Renovated Family Entertainer
From its sun-bathed interior to its harmonious treed setting, this attractive fully renovated family home has it all.
Step inside and discover a warmly inviting open plan with a bay-windowed master suite with stylish ensuite, two further bedrooms with built in robes and a bright and airy contemporary bathroom, with separate toilet and laundry.
Smartly presented, the kitchen takes centre stage with a peninsular island bar, 900mm stainless steel cooker and plenty of preparation and storage. The meals area is linked to the family area, while continuing in the other direction, there is a substantial lounge with a freestanding natural gas fire & split system toward the North. Glass French doors connect to the large alfresco zone with a fabulous footprint to further entertain or dine.
Outside there are two single lock up garages, plus town water, a further garden shed to the top of the block (with rear access), a handy water tank help with the garden thirst, lovely pathways, solid stairs, retaining rock walls and established shade trees spotted about the 1600m2 allotment. Instant turf has been laid directly next to the alfresco zone for dirt free play for children or pets.
An abundance of curb appeal, a generously accommodated house and a family-friendly floorplan combine here to create a place that you'll be proud to call home.

DO YOU LOVE GARDENING?
Garden Lovers - this neat and well presented two bedroom home in beautiful tree lined Cambridge Street, Creswick is a touch of the good life.
A variety of fruit trees adorn the large block, including fig, apple, plum, peach, nectarine and there's more, while the rear yard includes a free roaming chook pen with plenty of room for veggies all watered by a 6000L water tank. The private backyard is shaded in part by mature trees and also includes a cosy undercover deck and large sunny patio. Securely fenced in colorbond, the yard also includes a large powered shed and a small garden shed.
Two good sized bedrooms both with built in robes, a beautiful bathroom renovation 2018, updated kitchen with BOSCH dishwasher, spacious lounge/dining area makes for relaxed and comfortable living with all windows showcasing the colourful gardens.
Just around the corner from the vibrant Creswick shopping strip which includes medical facilities, chemist, supermarket, a variety of speciality shops, excellent pubs and walking distance to both primary schools and kindergarten.
This pretty home is nestled in a super spot of peaceful enjoyment in the fast growing township of Creswick.

Picture Perfect and Historic Creswick Cottage
Superbly situated and painstakingly renovated, this beautiful 1890's miners cottage is loaded with warmth and vintage charm while offering all the modern conveniences.
The first thing you will notice as you stand on the front porch is the stunning views across historic Creswick to the hill of Springmount and beyond.
Internally the home offers polished timber floors through out the living zones, dado paneling, along with classic tongue and groove timber ceilings. Both Bedrooms offer built in robes, wall to wall carpets and the stunning white paint palette that features throughout the home, while plantation shutters add an extra level of charm and sophistication.
The lounge room features a rustic yet modern wood combustion heater under a detailed timber mantle to keep you cozy in the winter months while the reverse cycle heating and cooling keeps the temperature just right through out the year.
Step through the doorway to the Living & Dining area and you truly see old and new combine to create a space that is light filled and inviting, seamlessly connecting with the modern kitchen, complete with quality stainless steel gas cook-top, electric oven and range-hood, Subway tile splash backs and country style cabinetry.
The bathroom features quality tiles, dado paneling and a step through double shower to add a level of opulence.
The timber sliding doors in the living area open to the quaint and neatly brick paved side court yard, where you can share a wine while shaded by the ancient apple tree. As you meander around the gardens you will discover a raised garden bed, beautifully maintained lawns and a myriad of floral colours exploding around you. The court yard and rear gardens are securely fenced, while to the other side of the property you have more open space to add your on touch.
The property also provides you with a fully powered lock up garage, with a concrete floor, complete with ample workshop space and wood combustion heater (making it an ideal man or woman cave).
Add to this continuous gas hot water, NBN, a short walk to shops, transport and everything else that this thriving town has to offer
This home represents great value for the owner occupier, holiday let investor or would even make the ideal weekender for those wanting to escape the city to the popular destination of Creswick.

Tranquil 40 Acre Property With Current Town Planning Permit
Ideally located near the hamlets of Blampied and Eganstown and just 10 minutes to Daylesford, this 40 acre approx. property has the advantage of a current planning permit to build a dwelling. With views to Mt Franklin and Mt Kooroocheang, the property's many attributes include partial sealed road access, large dam, productive basalt loam pasture and power available for connection at the north western boundary. The land would be ideal as a hobby farm, equine property or tranquil country retreat. "Permit ready" acreage properties like this are becoming increasingly rare, so enquire now.

Charming Renovation & Popular Locale of Pretty Residence
This charming home is sure to cause a stir. Each residence of recent times in this locale have sold quickly and been highly sought. The dwelling has had much love of recent times with freshly stained floorboards, new carpet, being painted throughout and being relined. The new owners will enjoy the refurbished kitchen and updated bathroom. You will be comfortable all year round with both heating and cooling. Outside the large allotment grants yard space for kids and pets, a tandem carport, double garage and garden shed. This sweet abode is blessed with fabulous natural light and overlooks a tree lined street and school yard. A one minute walk back into the hub of town brings a lovely lifestyle for those who enjoy a coffee or a bit of shopping.

COUNTRY ROADS LEADS TO HOME
Have you been dreaming of that private country escape? Then this three bedroom mud brick and corrugated iron home on 10 acres (approx.) could be the end of your search. Mud brick, exposed beams and cathedral style ceilings carry the charm of this fabulous home. Flowing through from the formal living area is the open plan kitchen and dining area. The renovated kitchen with stunning slate floor oozes country style with terrific Falcon 90cm double oven, dishwasher and lovely stone benchtops. The main generous living area is light-filled with split system for heating/cooling and the other formal living room offers a cozy wood heater and built-in storage. Three bedrooms, the master with stunning renovated ensuite and large walk-in robe with storage galore. Outside there is a further powered bungalow/studio which could be utilised as a fourth bedroom. Quaint family bathroom with shower over bath and separate laundry and toilet. Entertaining is a breeze with back undercover area including power and ceiling fans. Further features of this property include 4 large water tanks, mains power plus solar power back to the grid, a large dam, double carport and single LUG with workshop, dog run and more. View to appreciate.
Contact Alisa Johnson at our Maryborough Office on 0409 935 766

Large Rural Entertainer on approx. 9 Acres
Nestled in the private bush setting of Blampied this private and well-presented home offers the best of country living overlooking a picturesque dam. The large floorplan offers 3/4 good sized bedrooms, with the master offering BIRs and ensuite bathroom. The country style kitchen features granite benchtops, oak cupboards, ample storage, bench space and dining space overlooking the bushland surrounds. A separate family/dining room leads to the large lounge area. The jewel of the property is the outdoor entertaining decking overlooking the dam which can be enclosed with outdoor blinds. Shedding is in an abundance with a double car garage, high bay machinery shed and 4-bay shed with a fully lined storage workshop space.
- 3.626ha or 8.96 acres - Rural Living Zone
- Mains power, 10ka solar sysem back to grid, bottled gas, septic system
- Ducted reverse cycle heating/cooling & fan forced wood heater
- 2 x 5,000 Gal rain water tanks, mineral water bore, large dam with jetty
- 15m x 7.6m shed concreted with power, 12m x 12m hi bay shed with power connected
- Raised vegetable gardens & native Australian trees
This property is sure to impress and inspections are highly recommended

address: CA 6&9/22/510 Avoca Road Amherst Talbot VIC 3371
description:
BEAUTIFUL COUNTRY ACREAGE
So you want to country getaway. what about this beautiful 20 acres only minutes from the township of Talbot and close to Maryborough for supplies. Fenced and a great campsite. Farming zone, no permits, all enquiries re building should please refer to Central Goldfields Shire. Large dam on property and you just never know if the next big gold nugget could be on this property, as it's close to a reef this property is being held by one family for a number of years and now is your opportunity to own your own peace of the goldfields. Call to find out more information.

Captivating Creswick Cottage on generous block close to town
Situated close to the centre of town close to shops, cafes and restaurants in highly sought after Creswick is this charming home that offers quality living on a
wonderfully spacious block. The home features three good sized bedrooms, separate living area with gas heating as well as a great kitchen with lots of cupboard and bench space and open plan dinning. There is a split system in the kitchen. From the dining area there is direct access outside to a generous pergola which would be perfect for outdoor entertaining especially during the summer months. The backyard enjoys an abundance of space with garden beds. A must to inspect.
JD1411

Dual Living on the Golf Course
This exciting property measures over one acre in size, boasts two dwellings and stunning gardens. Sitting on the fringe of the 14th Tee & the 13th Green of the Forest Resort the serenity rolls on. In arguably Creswick's quietest street, the main abode offers four generous bedrooms, an ensuite to the master and two bright living rooms overlooking lush gardens. The large woodfire will ensure you keep warm all year round. The second home has two bedrooms and is self-contained, making the perfect spot for the extended family, guest house or even rent it out separately to generate an alternate income. Adjoining the main dwelling is a large entertaining area that makes for the perfect spot to sit back and relax as you look over your beautiful landscape garden and take in golf course views. There is also the added benefit of great shedding outside, perfect for home workshop or storage. Properties such as these are rare to find and the tranquil setting only adds to that, be quick to book your inspection before it's too late.
